com.att.research.xacml.api

Interface Request

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JaxpRequest, StdMutableRequest, StdRequest

    public interface Request
    Provides the API for objects that represent XACML Request elements. Requests are used to specify the contents of a XACML decision request.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Implementations of the Request interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Requests (r1 and r2) are equals if: r1.getRequestDefaults() == null && r2.getRequestDefaults() == null OR r1.getRequestDefaults().equals(r2.getRequestDefaults()) AND r1.getReturnPolicyIdList() == r2.getReturnPolicyIdList() AND r1.getCombinedDecision() == r2.getCombinedDecision() AND r1.getRequestAttributes() is pairwise equal to r2.getRequestAttributes() AND r1.getMultiRequests() is pairwise equal to r2.getMultiRequests()
      boolean getCombinedDecision()
      Returns true if the results from multiple individual decisions for this Request should be combined into a single XACML Result.
      java.util.Collection<RequestReference> getMultiRequests()
      Gets the Collection of RequestReferences representing XACML MultiRequest elements in this Request.
      java.util.Collection<RequestAttributes> getRequestAttributes()
      Gets the Collection of RequestAttributes representing XACML Attributes elements for this Request.
      java.util.Iterator<RequestAttributes> getRequestAttributes(Identifier category)
      Gets an Iterator over all of the RequestAttributes objects found in this Request with the given Identifier representing a XACML Category.
      RequestAttributes getRequestAttributesByXmlId(java.lang.String xmlId)
      Gets a single matching RequestAttributes representing the XACML Attributes element with whose xml:Id matches the given String>
      java.util.Collection<AttributeCategory> getRequestAttributesIncludedInResult()
      Gets the Collection of RequestAttributes representing XACML Attributes elements for this Request that contain Attributes where getIncludeInResults is true.
      RequestDefaults getRequestDefaults()
      Gets the RequestDefaults representing the XACML RequestDefaults for this Request.
      boolean getReturnPolicyIdList()
      Returns true if the list of XACML PolicyIds should be returned for this Request.
      Status getStatus()
      Gets the Status representing the XACML Status element for the Request represented by this Request.

    • Method Detail

      • getRequestDefaults

        RequestDefaults getRequestDefaults()
        Gets the RequestDefaults representing the XACML RequestDefaults for this Request.
        Returns:
        the RequestDefaults representing the XACML RequestDefaults for this Request.

      • getReturnPolicyIdList

        boolean getReturnPolicyIdList()
        Returns true if the list of XACML PolicyIds should be returned for this Request.
        Returns:
        true if XACML PolicyIds should be returned, otherwise false

      • getCombinedDecision

        boolean getCombinedDecision()
        Returns true if the results from multiple individual decisions for this Request should be combined into a single XACML Result.
        Returns:
        true if multiple results should be combined, otherwise false.

      • getRequestAttributes

        java.util.Collection<RequestAttributes> getRequestAttributes()
        Gets the Collection of RequestAttributes representing XACML Attributes elements for this Request. The Collection should not be modified. Implementations are free to use unmodifiable lists to enforce this.
        Returns:
        the Collection of RequestAttributes representing XACML Attributes elements for this Request.

      • getRequestAttributesIncludedInResult

        java.util.Collection<AttributeCategory> getRequestAttributesIncludedInResult()
        Gets the Collection of RequestAttributes representing XACML Attributes elements for this Request that contain Attributes where getIncludeInResults is true.
        Returns:
        a Collection of RequestAttributes containing one or more Attributes to include in results.

      • getRequestAttributes

        java.util.Iterator<RequestAttributes> getRequestAttributes(Identifier category)
        Gets an Iterator over all of the RequestAttributes objects found in this Request with the given Identifier representing a XACML Category.
        Parameters:
        category - the Identifier representing the XACML Category of the ReqestAttributes to retrieve.
        Returns:
        an Iterator over all of the RequestAttributes whose Category matches the given Identifier

      • getRequestAttributesByXmlId

        RequestAttributes getRequestAttributesByXmlId(java.lang.String xmlId)
        Gets a single matching RequestAttributes representing the XACML Attributes element with whose xml:Id matches the given String>
        Parameters:
        xmlId - the String representing the xml:Id of the RequestAttributes to retrieve
        Returns:
        the single matching RequestAttributes object or null if not found

      • getMultiRequests

        java.util.Collection<RequestReference> getMultiRequests()
        Gets the Collection of RequestReferences representing XACML MultiRequest elements in this Request.
        Returns:
        the Collection of RequestAttributes representing XACML MultiRequest elements in this Request.

      • getStatus

        Status getStatus()
        Gets the Status representing the XACML Status element for the Request represented by this Request.
        Returns:
        the Status representing the XACML Status element for the Request represented by this Request.

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Implementations of the Request interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Requests (r1 and r2) are equals if: r1.getRequestDefaults() == null && r2.getRequestDefaults() == null OR r1.getRequestDefaults().equals(r2.getRequestDefaults()) AND r1.getReturnPolicyIdList() == r2.getReturnPolicyIdList() AND r1.getCombinedDecision() == r2.getCombinedDecision() AND r1.getRequestAttributes() is pairwise equal to r2.getRequestAttributes() AND r1.getMultiRequests() is pairwise equal to r2.getMultiRequests()
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
